benchmark_details.name: TELEVAL (A Dynamic Benchmark Designed for Spoken Language Models in Chinese Interactive Scenarios)
benchmark_details.overview: TELEVAL is a dynamic benchmark specifically designed to evaluate Spoken Language Modelsâ€™ effectiveness as conversational agents in realistic Chinese interactive settings. It categorizes capabilities into three evaluation dimensions: Explicit Semantics, Paralinguistic and Implicit Semantics, and System Abilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a user-centered evaluation framework that reflects user experiences and contributes to the development of dialogue-oriented spoken language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: TELEVAL primarily addresses only a subset of natural interaction scenarios in Chinese; models not included in the evaluation may be updated in future releases.

data.source: TELEVAL consists of various tasks built from realistic conversational scenarios using both real human and synthetic speech.
data.annotation: Data synthesized from TTS systems and real human recordings.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation scores are averaged based on specific criteria tailored to each task.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate strong capability in producing natural and appropriate responses in conversational contexts.
methodology.validation: TELEVAL is validated with multiple evaluation methods, ensuring diverse metrics are utilized.
